name: EPIC 220674823
scenarioDescription:
The EPIC 220674823 Exoplanetary System

EPIC 220674823 is a star with 0.97 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.98 times its radius. It is located 802.67 light years away from the solar system.

EPIC 220674823 is known to have 2 exoplanets in orbit around it.

EPIC 220674823 b

EPIC 220674823 b was discovered by the K2 observatory using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.01 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 0.57 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, EPIC 220674823.

The mass of EPIC 220674823 b is 4.03 times the mass of Earth. The radius of EPIC 220674823 b is 1.82 that of Earth. At 4.03 Earth masses, EPIC 220674823 b is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.

EPIC 220674823 c

EPIC 220674823 c was discovered by the K2 observatory using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.11 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 13.34 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, EPIC 220674823.

The mass of EPIC 220674823 c is 10.76 times the mass of Earth. The radius of EPIC 220674823 c is 2.73 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, EPIC 220674823 c is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system EPIC 220674823, which contains 2 planets and was discovered by K2.
